story_text.value:
Rocketgraph is a complete backend. Think of it like Firebase, but much better and open-sourced.

1. AWS RDS Postgres Database with 20 GB storage.

2. Hasura Console(SSL enabled deployment) to GraphQLise the Postgres DB and write granular level authorisation rules. It also provides realtime functionality so you can “subscribe” to your data however you like. Combine this with the authorisation rules and ensure that there is no data leak.

3. Hasura Batteries to manage Authentication with email/password, social and otp. It’s open-sourced.

4. Serverless functions to write additional backend code. All commits to your Github repo are picked up by our bot and compiled as thin AWS Lambdas.

I wrote a ton of tutorials and videos to help you get started with Rocketgraph. It’s free for 1 week without CC. You can build production grade web applications in minutes with Auth, DB and Realtime right out of the box.

title.value: Show HN: Build production grade web applications with authentication and GraphQL

story_text.value:
Hey HN,

Do you guys know of any GOOD Postgres loggers out there? I'm not taking about the ones made for Robots. I want to see some sexy ones. Since many days I have been installing pgAudit on my AWS RDS instance and to get logs into the Cloudwatch and then query them using CloudwatchLogs is a HUGE HUGE mess. And the resulting queries are so bloated with unnecessary information. I want to build a SEXY logger myself. Like get a slack message when your developer f*cks up by deleting a table in production. I don't want to go to cloudwatch logs and make queries and format them. I just want to know in a single statement what he has done and when. Do you guys know any such tools?

title.value: Ask HN: Are there any GOOD Postgres loggers out there?
